StoryText: On ‘Bring Your Kid To Work Day’ my kid is in the office with me.
Question: What should I have %Pron:1:2% do?

OptionText.Text: Pull up a chair and teach %Pron:1:2% what I am doing
Let %Pron:1:2% choose to do whatever %Pron:1:1% wants

OptionResult.Result: We have a fun time together but my kid sends out an unprofessional email on my behalf.
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: My kid and I have a fun time and I’m glad %Pron:1:1% enjoyed %Pron:1:5% but I probably should’nt have had %Pron:1:2% send out emails because one of those emails was unprofessional and went to an important client. Can I blame it on ‘Take Your Kid To Work Day’?

OptionResult.Result: My kid gets really interested in what I’m doing and we bond and have a good time and %Pron:1:1% actually helps me finish my work quickly.
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: It was great having my kid pull up a chair and work with me and %Pron:1:1% really seemed to absorb a lot. And %Pron:1:1% is so smart that %Pron:1:1% caught on quickly and helped me finish my work fast!

OptionResult.Result: My kid draws a picture of my boss that is unflattering, all my coworkers find it hilarious but my boss gets angry and I chastise my kid.
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: I had to give my kid a stern talking to which really upset %Pron:1:2% but the unflattering picture %Pron:1:1% drew of my boss was really bad and got my boss quite angry. Everyone else seemed to love it and cheered me on quietly on the side.

OptionResult.Result: My kid offers to help everyone in the office and brings my boss and coworkers snacks from the kitchen and they all love it!
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: My kid was great today, helping everyone out however %Pron:1:1% could, bringing people snacks, they all loved %Pron:1:2% and now they all love me too!
